        public InternetAddressHelper()

    • Method Detail

      • getRangeBoundaries

        public static java.lang.String[] getRangeBoundaries(java.lang.String address)
        Given an ip range in form 10.10.10.30-40 return an array with 2 strings: 10.10.10.30 and 10.10.10.40. The first will always be the lowest address, so that 10.10.10.40-30 would also return 10.10.10.30 and 10.10.10.40

      • isHostname

        public static boolean isHostname(java.lang.String address)
        Checks whether the given address is a valid hostname

      • isIpRange

        public static boolean isIpRange(java.lang.String address)
        Checks whether the given address is a valid ip address range, in the form: A.B.C.D-E

      • isSimpleIp

        public static boolean isSimpleIp(java.lang.String address)
        Checks whether the given address is a valid simple ip address

      • padAddress

        public static java.lang.String padAddress(java.lang.String address)
        Pads an address, filling with zeroes on the left. Example: 1.2.30.100 becomes 001.002.030.100

      • resolveAddressType

        public static InternetAddressHelper.AddressType resolveAddressType(java.lang.String address)
        Returns the address type, or null when invalid
